title: Museum Director Discovers His Mother’s Childhood Visit to the Smithsonian
description: By raising her son to be curious about the natural world, this mother helped shape the trajectory of the National Museum of Natural History

title: The Real Science Behind the Megalodon
description: As The Meg hits theaters, dive into what we really know about this chompy predator

title: The Student and the Spy: How One Man’s Life Was Changed by the Cambridge Five
description: An unlikely friendship with Guy Burgess, the infamous British double-agent, brought unexpected joy to Stanley Weiss

title: Snail Shells Add a New Twist to the Mystery of Animal Asymmetries
description: After more than a century of searching, scientists have discovered a gene in snails that may control asymmetries inside many animals

title: When Amelia Earhart and the 'Queen of Diamonds' Raced to Become the First Woman to Fly Across the Atlantic
description: Mabel Boll, a wealthy New York socialite, dreamed of making aviation history. But Earhart beat her to the finish line, completing the trans-Atlantic journey as a passenger in June 1928

title: The Forgotten Sisters Behind 'Happy Birthday to You'
description: Mildred and Patty Hill wrote the popular song's melody, but their contributions to American culture have long been overlooked

title: Moon Crater Spudis
description: A lunar landmark gets a new name to honor a distinguished scientist.

title: The Patient Astronaut
description: Bruce McCandless waited almost two decades for his first space flight.

title: Marsliner
description: Elon Musk’s giant Starship will leave the world behind.
